author: jeffyang1
title: Local Cardano Meetups
description: No hay ningún grupo de Meetup de Cardano en San Diego

f6_assessments.q0: Hosting 10 local events for $2,000 per event, or $400 per person expected is small return on investment. in a city like San Diego could help the Cardano community to grow. And no indication or mention of the proposers involvement after three months. Building a team to do beach cleanup sounds like a local community benefit not a Cardano benefit. How to be sure that people interested in Cardano are interested in pubic service (cleaning beaches). Seems like two different goals. Most communities grow out of enthusiasm, not thru paid services ($20k). If the motivation is money, I doubt the conviction. Most local hubs are self financing (attendance fee). Keys to success are invited speakers worth listening to. No mention of the type of meetings that would be held. Perhaps some link up with another club in Los Angeles would help getting started, to learn from their experience. Invite some members from another hub to join to get started. Lots missing from this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The approach seems like a social club with no emphasis on Cardano. They say: "The way we build this community is through fun meet up events like hosting hiking event, camping trips, beach clean ups, free beer sessions." The proposer's claim to build a team has no supporting information
f6_assessments.q2: The number of attendees at 10 meetings over 3 months does not signal longer term success. Any project needs effort to continue success. This proposal gives no information that attendance was real. Perhaps if video records of the meetings or a checkin record was offered attendance could be verified. As is self-reporting alone may not be reliable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal goals is aligned with the challenge setting, that is getting local San Diege people attending the event onboarded on Catalyst. The key metric is also aligned, to increase active participation in community event. And the proposal is able to scale to future address challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team has not included any LinkedIn account that could be checked. Less credibility to assure the Cardano Community if the team has experienced on it. The Meetup group is also still new with only 2 past events (1 event with only 1 attendee, and another event with 4 attendees. It's still new of course, and that's why they want to build the local community hub in San Diego. It would be great if the proposer could break down the budget more detail. As they ask 20000 USD, to pay venue, trips, perks and so on for only 4 events, it would be great if the proposer already do some research on how much cost do they really need. And not just some rough estimation. Other proposal from other community hub event, they could host more event with less budget (of course, each region will have different cost, but by giving detail budget break down, it will help to ensure that it's a really eligible project).
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, we can track how many meetup will be held via Cardano Meetup San Diego account. But how to track the usage of the budget? Please provide link to GitHub project or any official website. It would help Cardano Community to track your project progress after funded.

f6_assessments.q0: Community events help to boost the cardano ecosystem. I believe it ist a good idea to bootstrap a Cardano hub in San Diego.
f6_assessments.q1: I think it is good that the proposer already has experience in organizing events and already planned a first meeting since it shows the intentions of the proposer. What I would wish for the proposal is a more detailed break down of the budget. It would help to assess for the voter if it is the right amount needed.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal could me a little bit more detailed to assess it. Also the success metrics could have been scaling for maybe the first 10 meetings to see if they grow.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely there is no Cardano Meet up group in San Diego
. 
It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by building one of the largest meet up communities in San Diego
 
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating such a meet up community 
  Key metrics  would be  number of participants,  number of events, number of participants in each meeting, number of new proposers and voters for Catalyst.
  
The key metrics and goals of the proposal may fall within the scope of the challenge. It does not provide technical information on Catalyst per se but through fun events allows people to learn about it and become interested in Cardano and favorable to it.
   
Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more events

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the collaboration between community members in meetings, events, new collaborations, presentations and discussions. But the critical question is.. how will this benefit Cardano community? Will people just wear a T Shirt and party, and say we love Cardano but continue to use Fiat Currency and think of Cardano as a party provider? This is what I need to understand 

I can say that this proposal somewhat addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 4 star rating.


I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have not provided ample evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  hosting events. He should post FB profile, Insta profile, or Linkedin profile. There should be extensive coverage of events hosted to see his capability
  
 The links are not sufficient. 
 
I cannot assess if the proposer os well experienced and competent to do the events and build community
 
 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is not stated.
  
The team structure is not listed and experienced.
 
 
 The budget has  not been given in detail. Two broad categories  of a. shirts and hats b. event costs
 
The budget is  very high for a first round of funding to achieve the set goals.  
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required  
 

There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 

Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
 
Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work
 
 
The proposal doesnt give a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?

Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are not described.   
  
 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal  
 
Given experience and plan presented it is not highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is quite high hence I have given it a 3 star rating. It seems to be a series of parties or social gatherings with unknown budgets.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with some milestones of organizing events but this is a vary broad milestone. For a good proposal a much more detailed breakdown of event and event costs should be given. 

 

 There are  Metrics such of number of participants a and number of presentations and discussion rooms. 
  
 
The problem has been clearly understood but solution is vague. It is more of a social gathering than focused on the CHallenge goals.
  
 
    The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties.
 
  


Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.


The information provided is  not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a 2 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I have organized various events and know about the importance of setting them up properly content-wise for them to be successful, so I am confident I can determine whether their concepts are set up in a meaningful manner. Since I am also Participating in catalyst since several funds I am competent to determine what kind of community events could be beneficial. While the proposal relates to the challenge, it does not dive deeply enough into the challenge metrics and does not adress them concretely enough. Feedpack: articulate more clearly what exactly the purpose of those meetups are going to be (in more than one sentence).
 It is not exactly clear whether this is a scalable proposal. With growing membership, the proposer would need to support more people. However, since the proposer has submitted a total of seven proposals and will be quite caught up in furthering all of them, it can be doubted that he will be able to support a bigger group continuously.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is according to himself, is a propelling engineer at SpaceX. He does not talk at all about his skills regarding blockchain and Cardano, so it is unsure whether he will be up to the challenge of supporting members of a Cardano meetup in that area.  In this context, it can also be said that the proposer does not identify other team members that might support him with this.
The budget only is very coarse-grained and does not give a more detailed rationale for the two positions that are presented there. That being said, the two posts presented do not seem reasonable. 5000$ for member perks and 15000$ for work hours and events which are not even defined yet seem unreasonable. During my political work, I have organized very sophisticated events on much less money hence I also know that a simple meetup can be made on much less money. The events that are presented do not give any information about their contents, which should be at least done in order to justify the budget. No plan is presented for the case that additional funds will be required, which should be done in a more sophisticatedproposal, but since the funds demanded so far have not even been properly justified, it seems the proposer simply has not thought deeply about allocation of funds.
The proposer offers a brief timetable for the first three months, but does not go beyond that, which does not meet the proposal requirements as normally milestones up to 12 months are required. Feedback: Generally give more thought into the details of what you want to do, when and how you want to do it ahead of proposing.
In its current form, the proposal does not provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation since a lot of the whats and hows are not explained.
Challenges, resources required and all the deeper details are not considered in the proposal, so it does not seem feasible at the moment. General feedback: Try starting with 1 or 2 proposals next time and make them really sophisticated instead of starting up with seven proposals that are not properly planned. Nobody will benefit from you overworking yourself, neither yourself, nor the community or the quality of your projects.
f6_assessments.q2:
A roadmap with some loosely defined milestones has been made for the first three months, but for the time after that nothing more auditable is presented.  Metrics/KPIs are implicitly formulated, however they are not detailed enough and hence only account for quantitiy, not for quality.
  The targeted problem is simple and formulated, however the solution to it could be more detailed in order to be properly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The intent of this proposal is beautiful. Which is onboarding new people onto Cardano through a hybrid social and educational event, though this proposal is very much more towards the social aspect of things which is conveyed in the use of the budget. This proposal does clearly articulate how it will add new members to the ecosystem but it is unclear whether those new members will add value to Cardano or just be new members. At this current moment Cardano needs effective onboarding and adoption, and although a hybrid approach is needed, a balance between social and educational event is essential. With that said this proposal is not perfectly aligned with the Challenge setting and therefore would not be effective. The spirit of the proposer is amazing though and highly recommend to reach out to Catalyst Swarm or Cardano Ambassadors to further formulate a balanced hybrid social educational event.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the relevant experience, although there are no links to verify this, there is a possibility of having a social Cardano event by this proposer being successful. Seeing that this is an offline event with many moving parts it is highly likely there will be need to form a team which is not mentioned here. This is mirrored on the budget requested. It is very much a general overview with out or very minimal details. Being detailed in budget formatting and roadmaps is a foundation of a good program which unfortunately this proposal is still lacking. Since it is an offline event one would expect some form of marketing on it which is not mentioned. If the goal is just to have an event then this proposal might suffice, but Cardano's goal is more than that, it is about voter participation, new member integration, increase collaboration in Project Catalyst etc. This proposal unfortunately will most likely not be successful in achieving the metrics Cardano intends to reach. Please do be more involved with our online community to have a gist of what Cardano community is all about. Catalyst Swarm or Project Catalyst Discord would be a great start.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap provided, it is quite simple and for the scope this proposal wants to achieve, it would suffice. The following KPI's although basic are also provided. For the sake of auditability, would be great if the proposer mentioned; the use of Meet-up as a attendance reporting tool and that there is an effort to document the event, which can also be used as a marketing tool to be used in the event's social media. With that said, auditing this proposal in it's current form will be challenging. In regards towards their problem statement and solutions, it most definitely could have been worded better in a way that shows the solutions provides more than just being a meet-up. Getting across these two points in an impactful way are essential for they are among the very first descriptions the voter sees in the voter app.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement is clear, and suitable for the given challenge.
Solution fit to the challenge, however, some explanation is needed (ex: the target audience is quite broad - all kinds of people who live in San Diego) so proposer should consider clarifying the target group, because this affect how the plan would be designed. Besides, the expected impact on the Cardano ecosystem should be explained more. 
Therefore, I am neutral with this proposal's impact, and give a score of 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team's ability (skill, experiences) is suitable for implementation without reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. There is a lack of similar works/activities (meet-ups events) that built by your team. The budget structure is not provided (only the total budget). Risk is not defined, and mitigation as well. The roadmap should be explained more in detail with KPIs/ metrics.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility and rate 3 points.
f6_assessments.q2:
Team profile is described enough for understanding but without reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. The budget is only with the total budget, without item structure, explanation. The roadmap is provided but abstract, and without KPIs/ Metrics for community tracking. My advice is: this proposal should provide more detail in order to facilitate the monitoring of the community 
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability and give a score of 2.

f6_assessments.q0: The Local Cardano Meetups proposal aims to provide local meet ups in San-Diego, where there are currently no Cardano meetups. The idea is aligned with the challenge in that the proposer intends on creating highly engaging meet up experiences that will provide information to Cardano-curious people and those that are already involved in the community. They have some innovative ideas to broaden awareness such as beach clean up initiatives that draw attention to the environmentally friendly aspects of Cardano. There is some questionable suggestions such as singles nights which reads as a breeding program? Interesting premise.
f6_assessments.q1:
There's very little information on the proposers' skills and aptitudes and experience with Cardano, they have organised one meet up so far that has had four people attending in San Diego. It's possibly a good idea to see if there are others in the community that might have more knoweldge and are better positioned to speak and share insights? 


There is a vague timeframe which just states that they are monthly events and the budget leaves a lot to be desired, most of the expenditure is going towards two large items the cost of merch and office space or hosting events space and trips. It's unlikely this is the kind of project that would need a great deal of detail however it would be good to see more thought put into the program and what kind of content they would be discussing at each meet up, how they are going to engage more people etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is little information about how the community could track the project however there is a github link with the most recent event and photos there, so it's likely the same method would be used for other events for community to track it. 

KPI's are very much centred around actual attendance and onboarding people to Cardano. The delivery dates aren't clearly defined but it is a 3 month period.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an intelligent proposal. I like the fact that the proposal has indicated the problem clearly that is to be solved from the challenge. If the team is able to achieve their proposal then there will be growth for Cardano. It's good that the goals of the proposal are outlined and having been outlined they also fit into the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has got some experience and have attached a link to that effect. However, I see the team to be vague because the number of members are not stated or their names. The budget is not broken down into identifiable items. The fact that the proposal has a detailed plan would help to ensure its implementation. The proposal has not captured risks/challenges associated with the implementation.
I have seen that the team explained some technical terms used in the proposal for easy understanding.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a roadmap and time horizon for implementation. Success metrics have been included as well, and that for me is good.

f6_assessments.q0: This project would for the first time educate people in San Diego and it is a good thing to grow the knowledge base of Cardano. The more ideas of freedom to buy, hold and own coins the more Cardano community grows. This is a good project and achievable in the short-term.
f6_assessments.q1: The project has a measurable outputs and outcomes with duration and number of individuals to be educated. I suggest, the number of individual attendees should be scaled up to at least 80+ for each event to deepen the base of making Cardano more popular in San Diego. Projects with such outputs would have impact. After all the events, what will be the impact to help grow the Cardano Community.
f6_assessments.q2: I also suggest the project should have a measurable impact. It means the project could increase the number of attendees from 5% - 20% from previous event to the others. This will measure the growth of interest for Cardano. Should the attendees number reduce from one event to the other then there's a cause to worry.

f6_assessments.q0: Great initiative. Great to see the expansion of the catalysts community in San Diego. The idea is great with a variety of event sessions. I think it is going to be engaging.
f6_assessments.q1: This would great extra hand and it is great to have a partnership with local vendors for the execution. The team has local knowledge component to enable execution. Also, the target group is too open, it would be helpful to target specific groups with the San Diego community with different events.
f6_assessments.q2: The event would be easy to track looking at various breakdown activities with monthly timelines. However, the proposal should have a detailed auditing process to make it a bit easier for the catalyst community.

f6_assessments.q0: Meet up events, mentorship, conferences and workshops are all great avenue for expanding the cardano user base. The idea of capturing the community of San Diego into the cardano ecosystem via a meet up event is an excellent idea and will definitely add value to the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience for hosting large events makes the team lead a credible and ideal person for the project. Also, the project provides a clear work breakdown structure outlined to execute the proposal from the start to the finish. Additionally, the project provides a clear timeline for each event, with a set target for both the short and long term with a well identified target audience. Finally a detailed breakdown of budgetary allocation is provided for the proposal. Without a doubt, I'm clear in my mind that this project will be executed successfully when provided the fund.
f6_assessments.q2: The project provides a metric to monitor and track the progress and success of the project. For instance, the project has an outlined number of people it expects to participate in community organized events.

solution: Construir una de las mayores comunidades de encuentro en San Diego
experience: Tengo experiencia en la organización de fiestas de gran tamaño. También conectado con los proveedores locales para acoger.
